exploration.p: In this preview activity, we explore whether certain differential equations are separable or not, and then revisit some key ideas from earlier work in integral calculus.

li.p: Which of the following differential equations are separable? If the equation is separable, write the equation in the revised form g(y) \frac{dy}{dt} = h(t).
Explain why any autonomous differential equation is guaranteed to be separable.

Why do we include the term +C in the expression
\int x~dx = \frac{x^2}{2} + C?

Suppose we know that a certain function f satisfies the equation
\int f'(x)~dx = \int x~dx.
What can you conclude about f?
